utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brought you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so uh, just randomly like 2 days ago I just started having this chest pain when I'm breathing and it's just been getting worse and then because of that, I'm finding that I'm very short of breath as well, so I just got really concerned.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. When did the chest pain start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So, there was some discomfort like just 2 days ago, but then just yesterday it started getting very painful when I was breathing. So yeah, I would say 1 day ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and were you doing anything at the time when the chest pain started? Like did you get in a car accident maybe? Or any trauma to the chest or anything you can think of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. I was just at home and then I noticed that when, I like, take a deep breath in, it's just, like, a very sharp pain. It's kind of like in my right side of the chest and it feels like a stabbing pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so the pain comes on when you breathe in, or yeah, when you take a deep breath. Does the pain come on at any other points or does it go away?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it's mostly, yeah, I feel the sharp pain when I breathe in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so the pain is intermittent then, it sounds like. And has there been anything you've tried that's made the pain better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, just more shallow breathing, and it hurts less with that, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are there any positions that help make the pain any better like leaning forward or laying down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, it's uh, it's pretty much the same, I think.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, you mentioned you had shortness of breath as well. When does this come on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Since yesterday it's been pretty constant and it's more like, Uh, just uh, I'm really having trouble getting any deep breaths in, so I feel like I'm having to just breathe faster and more shallow.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK, and has anything like this happened to you before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been experiencing any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any viral symptoms, like eye redness, nasal discharge, or nasal congestion or cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have been having a little bit of a cough, but that's it, like, it kind of started today, but it's nothing too significant.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, is the cough dry or have you brought up sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It is dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about a loss of taste or a loss of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how has your appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My appetite's been pretty good. It's like, definitely with the pain, I don't really feel like eating today, but I don't think it's changed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so has your weight been stable over the last several months.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, weight has been stable.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any fevers, chills, or night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any episodes where you feel like your heart is, like, racing or beating out of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any dizziness or Lightheadedness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and with the cough, have you brought up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any, Uh, like urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any bowel problems like diarrhea or Constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any muscle aches, joint pains or skin changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uhm, in the past have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been pretty healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so do you take any medications regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any hospitalizations in the past or any surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and currently, can you tell me just a little bit about your living situation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I just live with uh, a couple of my roommates. I'm going to University.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in like a student housing situation.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has anybody in the house been sick or anybody that you've been around been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, we've been all pretty healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke cigarettes or use any like vape products or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't ever smoked. I do smoke weed like, I would say, once or twice a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much would you say? Like 1 gram or less or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: 1 gram probably lasts like 2 weeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just a couple of beers maybe on the weekend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just one partner, my girlfriend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, do you use condoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, we use condoms, we're pretty safe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a sexually transmitted infection before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any concerns right now or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh, we've been pretty safe and we've both been tested before and everything, so I'm not really concerned.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great and has anybody in the family had like a similar presentation before, like any lung problems or heart problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I think my sister, she has asthma, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, any cancers that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it sounds like you had this uncomfortable feeling in your chest about two days ago, but the pain really came on yesterday and it's really painful when you have a deep deep breath. So, in conjunction with your symptoms of not being able to take a deep breath and being short of breath, it sounds like you possibly have what's called a pneumothorax and so we'll do a physical exam and do a chest X-ray as well to examine this and check vitals as well to make sure that you're work of breathing is OK and we can do some blood work and go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, yeah, sounds good. Should be like, worried at all?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I think right now, you're speaking in full sentences and you're not short of breath at rest, typically, when this this happens, if it's small enough, it'll usually resolve on its own and so we'll get some more information from the imaging and the lab results, but it's reassuring that you haven't been getting worse since it happened.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
